overview: Dr. Centola is a cofounder of Crescendo Bioscience. In addition to serving as Chief Scientific Officer, he manages the discovery and research facility for Crescendo Bioscience. Dr Centola is also Adjunct Associate Professor in the Department of Microbiology and Immunology and the Department of Medicine at the University of Oklahoma Health Sciences Center, and Director for the Oklahama Medical Research Foundation (OMRF) Microarray Research Facility. He was recruited to the OMRF in 2000 from the National Institute of Arthritis Musculoskeletal and Skin Diseases at the National Institutes of Health (NIH). Dr. Centola has focused his research on the genetics, genomics and proteomics of inflammatory disease.
